actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil Service and General Services.
Committee on Governmental Affairs requested executive comment from GAO; OMB; Office of Federal Procurement Policy; General Services Administration.
Committee on Governmental Affairs received executive comment from OMB.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil Service, Post Office, and General Services

official_title: A bill to require disclosure of information relating to reports prepared for executive agencies by experts and consultants.
short_title: Federal Reports Authorship Disclosure Act of 1981

summary.text: Federal Reports Authorship Disclosure Act of 1981 - Requires any document which is published, distributed, or transmitted by an Executive agency and which contains information derived from a report prepared by an expert or consultant pursuant to an agency contract to disclose: (1) the names of the contributing experts or consultants; (2) the duration and cost of such contract; (3) the name of the agency employee who awarded the contract; and (4) the type of procurement utilized to select the contractor. Directs each agency to submit a copy of each document to the General Accounting Office. Requires the Office to maintain each document for five years.

titles.title: Federal Reports Authorship Disclosure Act of 1981
A bill to require disclosure of information relating to reports prepared for executive agencies by experts and consultants.
